Technique: PRESSED IN A FORM/MODEL; BURNED, OXIDIZED; PAINTED
Name: Terracotta of Harpocrates
Description: Terracotta representing Harpocrates with lightly bent legs, naked, with the index finger of the right hand at the mouth. He is wearing the atef-crown and the side lock of infancy. The clay is ochre in colour and bears some traces of white paint. In the back is a circular hole.
